meanings.definition: A type of shoe with laces.
meanings.sent1: I bought a new pair of oxfords for the party.
meanings.sent2: He polished his brown oxfords before the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The oxfords danced around the room on their own!
meanings.sent4: Her shiny oxfords were like two little soldiers on her feet.
meanings.sent5: The oxfords clicked on the floor, leaving a trail of elegance.

meanings.definition: A type of cloth with a basket weave.
meanings.sent1: The tablecloth was made of soft oxford fabric.
meanings.sent2: She sewed a beautiful dress using oxford material.
meanings.sent3: The oxford cloth felt like a cozy blanket on a chilly night.
meanings.sent4: The oxford fabric draped gracefully over the chair.
meanings.sent5: The oxford weave added a touch of sophistication to the curtains.

meanings.definition: A type of university in England.
meanings.sent1: She dreams of studying at Oxford one day.
meanings.sent2: Oxford University is known for its rich history.
meanings.sent3: The students at Oxford always seem to be in a hurry.
meanings.sent4: Attending Oxford is like stepping into a world of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The spires of Oxford rise majestically against the sky.
